intro: Borya stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf borya, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. Borya stenophylla is adapted to grow in rocky or well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
